title: (06200) Almendralejo - 651 N-630

title_short: (06200) Almendralejo - 67 Avenida Presidente Juan Carlos Rodríguez Ibarra

address.street: 67 Avenida Presidente Juan Carlos Rodríguez Ibarra

title: (06200) Almendralejo - 1G Calle Alange
description: Free parking area, authorized by the town hall, for vans, motorhomes and caravans (paved, 8 spacious spaces). It is allowed to spend the night and the area is very quiet. It has an area for emptying gray and black water. Currently there are two drinking water taps but neither of them work and they do not have a socket to connect a hose.

title: (06840) Alange - Carretera Palomas
description:
In the town of Alange, overlooking the water reservoir of the same name. Next to the football stadium there is a large free esplanade where you park and spend the night. The town is famous among other things for the Roman baths very close, besides activities in the nature: canoes, trekking, etc. Surrounded by small mountains of great beauty.
Park with water fountain next to the esplanade.

title: (06840) Alange - BA-005

title: (06210) Torremejía -

Park4Night urban-style dream. 
An industrialpark without industry (There is just one you can see on the satellite image). There are no signs that it is forbidden. Seems pretty silent. The highway is nearby but not really loud. And the streetlights don't switch on at night. Felt very safe sleeping here

title: (06830) La Zarza -

Quiet location next to an abandoned mine. Relatively flat, no blocks needed.
Has great sight over the surrounding area and some hiking tracks nearby.

The road is gravel but well maintained when coming from La Zarza

title: (06820) Don Álvaro -

title: (06830) La Zarza - Paraje Villagonzola
description: Access from BA-156. It is a place of fishing, picnic tables, families spend afternoons there. On Friday and Saturday evenings young people drink there in the evening. We spent a very quiet Sunday night there with the sound of frogs. A tree under which to have shade for small jigs (Iveco Daily goes there). Otherwise a fairly flat concrete platform is not shaded. Thank you for respecting the villagers who clearly have their habits there :)

title: (06175) Salvatierra de los Barros - EX-320

title: (06173) Nogales - Unnamed Road

Municipal swimming pools Just behind, Roman Theater 150m, Museum 300m ... finally a treat!

address.street: 3 Calle Juan de Dios Román Seco

title: (06800) Mérida - 24 Calle Octavio Augusto
description: Calle Octavio Augusto (Merida) very central and very large street. Busy enough for the day but quiet at night. A few meters from the amphitheater and the Roman Theater, Roman Museum. Near the center about 800 meters. Good for the night. A supermarket at 10m.

title: (06800) Mérida - 3 Carretera Matadero
description: Very quiet place with fair lighting, in the part d below a gas station that has a very nice employee, offering me gray emptying and connecting the hose for filling.

title: (06800) Mérida - 4 Calle Cabo Verde
description: Street with enough parking.5 minutes, 400 meters Teatro ROmano. very lit, quite nice.

title: (06800) Mérida - 3A Carretera al el Prado
description: Parking Merida Conference Center, you can stop and stay overnight, with spectacular view, very quiet place. I caught a public holiday and got fireworks for free so it was relatively quiet on the main street at night.

title: (06800) Mérida - 2 Calle Cabo Verde
description: The Roman Theater car park is now one of the most modern car parks in Mérida. It is equipped with the latest technological devices for safety, accessibility and comfort. It had a new and innovative image for its time and was close to all the monuments of the historic center of Mérida. a remarkable fact in another parking lot. Right next to the Roman Circus and Casa del Mitreo and 5 minutes walk from the Roman Theater and Amphitheater, it should be noted that within a 10-minute walk you can reach everything in the historic center: Aqueduct of Miracles, Temple of Diana , Roman Bridge, etc. Directly next to an indoor pool you can swim for a daily fee. Restaurants and shops in the area. It's not just a Womo parking lot, this space is also used by a whole squadron of buses. I wasn't allowed to drive in in the late afternoon, everything was full of buses and cars, the Womos were so narrow I wouldn't be there FREE STAY ??

title: (06800) Mérida - 31D Calle Almendralejo
description: Public parking, small. It is located next to the police and very close to everything. Next to it is a paid parking lot. We have slept very peacefully. There are 3 long seats 7m. Access is via a somewhat narrow ramp for a motorhome.

title: (06800) Mérida - 24 Calle Santa Lucía

title: (06800) Mérida - 28 Avenida Extremadura

title: (06800) Mérida - 1B Avenida Emérita Augusta
description: Gigantic parking on the river Guadiana. Asphalted. Space for many campingcars. 20min walking to the sights (Roman bridge, Alcazaba, Roman theater, etc.) along the river upstream. From the roundabout at the bridge drive about 300m on a one-way street to a turning circle whitch leeds you back on the river side of the parking lot. Attention! Every Tuesday from 5:00 to 15:00 weekly market. Almost completely occupied.

name: Autocaravanas Myriam area
title: (06800) Autocaravanas Myriam area
description: Very quiet private area with shade; It has very cheap rental vehicles in case you don't want to move the motorhome enclosure with fence and automatic door; electricity, water, toilet and showers with hot water, washer and dryer! At 100 meters is Myriam motorhomes who are the ones who run it and have all kinds of accessories. Totally RECOMMENDED

title: (06800) Mérida - 13 Plaza E Tierno Galván
description: Large parking lot next to the aqueduct and the quiet Mérida velodrome 1.2 km from the Roman Arena .. We will spend the night there ..

title: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
title_short: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
description:
OK first and foremost this is a great Aire. The community are providing an excellent place to park and an easy walk to the town and it’s amazing sights.

That said the booking system is awful. This is in part due to the fact the Aire is free at the moment and there is an incentive to book for three days even if you only stay one or two. This means there are unoccupied spaces that are showing up as occupied. 

It will bed down. When you check in only use the amount of days you require. Plus electricity can only be booked for two days. 

The shower ticket essentially is for the water, as both are unlocked. Again this is free at the moment an will give 15 min of hot and cold water. 

They will start charging in 2024 and perhaps it will get better.

title: (06498) Lobón - 37 Avenida Adolfo Suárez
description: Lobon area open from July 1, 2020 Public area with 10 places Urban area Avda Adolfo Suarez, 37 06498 Lobon Open 365 days and free Maximum parking time: 72 hours Drinking water: yes Gray water: yes Black water: yes Picnic area: yes Children's playground: yes Sports area: yes hostel / restaurant ....... 180 meters. Gas station self-service restaurant ....... 230 meters. Self-service meal ....... 500 meters

title: (06800) Mérida - 3 Avenida del Lago

title: (06800) Urbanización de Proserpina - 21A Avenida Proserpina

title: (06800) Mérida - 2 Calle Santiago Compostela

title: (06800) Mérida - 1 Avenida del Lago

title: (06800) Urbanización de Proserpina - 21A Avenida Proserpina
description: In the area of ​​the hermitage we have spent the night with the van, very quiet. Lake to bathe, very cool.

title: (06800) Mérida - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place to stop for the night by Proserpina lake, which was dammed in Roman times. Very quiet out of season, busy in summer. Tour of the lake on foot or by bike, 6 km. Quite close to the wonderful Roman remains at Merida.

title: (06800) Mérida - 1 Avenida del Lago
description: The place is good for a stop even though you can stay overnight! There are many beach bars! The distance of the silver road is about 7 km, the road is ride, but asphalted

title: (06800) Urbanización de Proserpina -
description: Quiet place in the middle of nature, next to a small airfield, on a dirt road with no traffic and next to a small stream, ideal for simple excursions on foot and by bike. We spent a quiet night. No service available. Access road a bit bumpy, with large campers there could be problems, to be evaluated after a rainy day. We achieved it with an Opel Vivaro.

title: (06340) Fregenal de la Sierra -

title: (06380) Jerez de los Caballeros - 48 Plaza de Toros

title: (06900) Llerena - 9C Travesía Ollerías
description: Quiet place, next to the Constitution Park. At about two hundred meters there is the monumental Plaza de España, and you can see the silhouette of its tower at the end of the park. Llerena is a monumental city that is well worth a visit. In the park there is a cafeteria for the elderly home, with free admission, good prices and dancing on Sundays. There are large sewers to evacuate gray water next to the parking lot and I think public services in the park.

title: (06893) San Pedro de Mérida - A-5

title: (06900) Llerena - 36 Calle San Pedro

There are many bars nearby where you can eat something and even stores that sell local products at a good price in the same square. 100% recommended

title: (06894) Aljucén - 11 Calle San Andrés

title: (06270) Segura de León - 20 Calle Cementerio

title: (06260) Monesterio - EX-103
description: Picnic area above a lake with direct access to the water, barbecue areas, garbage can and picnic benches in the shade. The terrain is a little steep, but you can park right under the trees next to the tables. Nice view and few mosquitos.

title: (06260) Monesterio -

Some waste is a shame. Accessible by van, quite narrow for a campsite because I think. Earthy, sloping and uneven ground, surely not very passable on a rainy day.
